EmailTemplate.name: RE: Previous Account (1332431500.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Previous Account (1332431500.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Dear Chris, Welcome back to MBO! My name is Sara Conde and I will be your point of contact at MBO Partners. You will have the same account as you did before. Please follow the steps below to complete your re-enrollment. - Log in to the MBO site www.mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCVlBesV44xvOLI63NnDzUNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> - Click the “Enrollment” link once you are logged in - Confirm contact information - Print out I-9 at the end of the enrollment - You will sign/date section 1 and local notary will sign/date section 2 (most people visit their local bank.) Please email or fax back to MBO (we do not need an original copy.) If you use a US passport as supporting documentation I will need an image of it to comply with E-Verify (most people just take a picture with their phone and then email it to me.) Please sent me you client’s contact information (when appropirate) and I will reach out to get an agreement in place. We are gald to have you back! Take care,Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Chris Cleary [mailto:cgcleary@hotmail.com] <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCVlBesV44xvOLI63NnDzUNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Sent: Wednesday, March 21, 2012 12:42 PM To: Jessica Hartman Subject: Previous Account I had an account with MBO partners a while back when I was consulting, I stopped consulting for a while but am starting up again. What do i need to do to reactivate my account? Will it be the same as if I'm starting a new account? The email address I was using back then was chris@cleary.us <mailto:chris@cleary.us>. Thanks, Chris Cleary 301-602-0314
